A female of 36 weeks gestation presents with following signs shown in image patient have hypertension, blurring of vision and headache. Her blood pressure reading was 180/120 mm Hg and 174/110 mm Hg after 20 minutes. How will you manage the patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Admit the patient, start antihypertensive and continue pregnancy till term

options.label: C
options.text: Admit the patient, start antihypertensive, mg SO4 and terminate the pregnancy

options.label: D
options.text: Admit oral antihypertensives and follow up in outpatient department

questions.correct_answer: C. Admit the patient, start antihypertensive, mg SO4 and terminate the pregnancy

A 28-year-old pregnant woman at 36 weeks of gestation presents for a routine antenatal check-up. During the pelvic examination, the obstetrician measures the diagonal conjugate. The measurement is found to be 11 cm. What is the significance of this measurement?

options.label: A
options.text: Normal diagonal conjugate, reassuring for a vaginal delivery

options.label: B
options.text: Short diagonal conjugate, indicating cephalopelvic disproportion

options.label: C
options.text: Long diagonal conjugate, suggestive of a contracted pelvis

options.label: D
options.text: Average diagonal conjugate, no specific concerns

questions.correct_answer: B. Short diagonal conjugate, indicating cephalopelvic disproportion
